result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Troy D. Rohland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order on Counts 1 and 2 of the Information and Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Proposed Order on Counts 1 and 2 of the Information and Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Letter from Attorney De La Rosa re proposed order for July hearing
Calendar call on August 13, 2020 at 09:00 am.

[MK; All appearances are by Zoom-conference.] 
case called at 11:06am 
Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears. Attorney Jodi Bollendorf appears as successor Special Prosecutor for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court notes that the appearance of Defendant Troy D Rohland at this hearing was previously excused.  The Court notes Attorney Buker has retired and is no longer the Special Prosecutor for the State. 
ADA Bollendorf indicates she now is assigned this case. She has reviewed the file of her office and she spoke with Attorney Buker about the case at length yesterday. ADA Bollendorf explains that Attorney Buker did not see the Court's 3/20/20 Order before she retired. ADA Bollendorf and Attorney Buker agreed that asking the law enforcement agency to issue citations for ordinance violations is not workable because the intent is that there would be nothing showing as a new-type filing.  ADA Bollendorf indicates that the conclusion has been reached that, based upon the fact that Mr. Rohland has no new violations showing on CCAP-records, the State will forego pursuing ordinance violations. 
ADA Bollendorf orally Motions to Dismiss Counts #1 & #2.   
The Court grants the oral Motion to Dismiss Counts #1 and #2.  
The Court and counsel discuss the drafting of a finalizing document. Counsel indicate that Attorney De La Rosa will draft the proposed order due to the problems that the State has been experiencing with e-filing in this case. The Court directs that the document should also recognize a bar of further prosecution of the ordinance actions. 
The Court and counsel address concerns regarding the 2/22/20 Amended Information charging eight counts.  Counsel indicate that the proposed order will include the State's withdrawal of that charging document. 
As to expungement of the case, Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the provisions for this are already in place. 
recess 11:20am.  

NEXT:  (1) Attorney De La Rosa will submit a proposed order for the 2/22/20 Amended Information to be withdrawn and for dismissal of Counts #1 and #2 and finalization of the case; (2) Calendar Call on August 13th at 9:00am--this hearing will be removed from the calendar if there are no unresolved issues
Review hearing on July 9, 2020 at 11:00 am.
Court's Response to ADA Buker's Letter
Review hearing on March 20, 2020 at 03:30 pm.
Transcript of 1/15/2016 Plea and Sentencing Hearing
Letter from Attorney Rumpf re Removal of Attorney of Record
Review hearing on March 20, 2020 at 03:30 pm.

[AR] Case called 3:16 PM
Defendant Troy D. Rohland in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  Special Prosecutor Katharine Buker appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
[This hearing is to address the pending status of Counts #1 and #2 , and also to address the issue that has been raised that expungement of only some of the counts within a multiple count case may not be possible--this is in regard to Counts #6, #7, #8 now that Mr. Rohland has completed the Probation term.] 

Attorney Buker indicates that they are still seeking select counts be expunged, requests specific counts be dismissed and read in, claims to have efiled Amended Information, however it is not located in the court file (Atty Buker provides paper copy to the Court). 

Attorney De La Rosa summarizes the agreed requests to be:
--Dismiss felony matters to which Def entered pleas
--Expunge misdemeanor theft convictions
--Allow Atty Buker to file (2) FO charges for theft, to which no contest/not guilty pleas would be entered.

Atty Buker agrees with record made, discusses the dismissal of the open felony matters.
The Court requests Atty Buker to reduce these agreements to writing, provide to Atty De La Rosa and efile with the Court.

The Court schedules the matter for continued calendar call hearing 3/20/20 3:30 PM 
The Court will allow telephone appearances by Atty Buker and Atty De La Rosa; Defendant is excused from personally appearing.

recess 3:31 PM
NEXT: Adjourned hearing 3/20/20 3:30 PM
Review hearing on February 20, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 10:06am 
Defendant Troy D. Rohland in court.  Special Prosecutor Katharine Buker appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled for the Court to address the status of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
Attorney Buker submits a copy of a document entitled "Amended Complaint to Forfeiture", indicating that she intends to e-file it.  Attorney Buker states that Mr. Rohland did enough of what he was supposed to do so that she is willing to [motion to] dismiss the felony, expunge the misdemeanors, and file an Amended Complaint that amends Counts #1 and #2 to Jefferson County Ordinance Theft.  Attorney Buker indicates that her reason for filing the amended pleading and having Mr. Rohland plead no-contest to those forfeiture-level charges is so that there is a history of the matter maintained. 
It is noted that the charging document in the case is an Information, and that any amendment would involve the filing of an Amended Information.
The Court and Attorney Buker discuss a concern raised by the clerk regarding whether expungement of only certain counts within a multiple count case is possible.  Thereafter the Court directs Attorney Buker to look into this and to further address the terms of the DPA with Mr. Rohland. Attorney Buker is to file a letter or further request on this by January 31st. 

The Court reviews right to counsel, referring Mr. Rohland to apply at the Public Defenders Office for representation.  If Mr. Rohland learns that he is not eligible for representation, then he should file a petition for the appointment of counsel by the Court. 
In response to the clerk's inquiry, Mr. Rohland verifies that the Monroe Street, Fort Atkinson address is current.
recess 10:22am.

NEXT:  (1) Special Prosecutor Buker will file a letter or revised request by 1/31/20;  (2) schedule the case for Review Hearing in mid-February

[MA]Case called at 9:35am
Defendant Troy D. Rohland in court. Special Prosecutor ADA Kate Ukker appearing by phone for State of Wisconsin.
Probation Agent, Paul Hasenstab appears in court

Mr. Rohland indicates that he has paid restitution in full; Agent Hasenstab confirms that restitution has been paid in full, some court costs remain in owing. 
The Court determines that Mr. Rohland's probation will conclude at the termination date ,since he has paid all restitution, at conclusion of court costs are to be reduced to civil judgment. Unless, DOC determines Mr. Rohland has not fulfilled all other conditions of probation and seeks extension.

recess: 9:40am
Probation review hearing on December 19, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Probation review hearing on December 22, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF333 and 15CT452 called together at 11:43am [mo]
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Troy D. Rohland in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   Special Prosecutor, Katherine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF333(Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occurs):
Mr.Rohland waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.
Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

ADA Buker submits an Agreement to Hold Open Felony Plea to the Court
Atty. De La Rosa summarizes the agreement of parties


Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1, #2  #6, #7, and #8; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty on all Counts and orders Judgment of Conviction entered on Counts #6, #7, and #8. 

The Court defers entry of Judgement on Counts #1 and #2

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts of Case 15CF333
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Rohland

On Counts #6, #7 and #8 of Case 15CF333, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--AODA treatment
--to pay restitution in the amount of #2,915.36 plus any applicable surcharges
--court costs

The Court grants Mr. Rohland expungement of Counts #6, #7, and #8 upon sucessful completion of Probation
The Court approves in full the Agreement to Hold Open Felony Plea.

ADA Buker verifies victim rights compliance
Days credit for time already served:  0  days

As to Case 15CT452:

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant: 

--To serve  60 days   in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on 1/25/16
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence and the alternate sentence, if served,with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process
--To pay fine of $400+ costs= $1,442, to be paid in $40 per month installments, commencing on  3/15/16 and on the 15th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 5 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--Revocation of drivers license for 14 months
--County alcohol and drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 14 month period  

--6 demerit points assessed
recess12:54pm

Cases 15CF333 and 15CT452 called together at 11:03am
Defendant Troy D. Rohland in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  Special Prosecutor, Katharine Buker appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that negoitiations are underway; requests a plea/sentencing date out 45 days. 
THe Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
The Court continues Mr. Rohland's bond. 
recess: 11:06am 

NEXT: Plea/Sentencing on 1/15/16 at 11:00am

Cases 15CF333 & 15CT452 called together at 2:18 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Troy D. Rohland in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. Special Prosecutor, Katharine Buker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa files Discovery Demands

Both Cases: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
15CF333: Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
15CT452: Pleas of "Not Guilty" entered; Speedy Trial waived by Defendant
Court continues bond as previously set
Recess: 2:22 pm 

NEXT: BOTH CASES (1) Pre-trial to be held informally (2) STC scheduled for at 12/1/15 at 11:00 am - Send notices

Cases 15CT452 and 15CF33 called together at 2:14pm [mo]
Defendant Troy D. Rohland in court.   Special Prosecutor, ADA Katharine Buker appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr. Rohland verifies his date of birth and address on both criminal complaints

As to Case 15CT452:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given


As to Case 15CF333:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given


As to both Cases 15CT452 and 15CF33:
The Court requires a $2,000 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--not to operate a motor vehicle after consuming any intoxicants including prescribed suboxone
--booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's department

Atty. Rohland indicates that he is eligible for SPD counsel, further indicates that counsel was unable to attend today
The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney/ as Jefferson County Assistant District Attorney. It did supervise and/or was a co-worker of the Defendant's mother. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed. 
recess: 2:35pm

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance on 10/27/15 at 2:00pm
